title: feat: subset type graph for JSR dependencies
body:
This is the first pass on adding a subset type graph for JSR dependencies. This type graph can then be provided to TypeScript instead of the original sources, causing very fast type checking and enabling the ability to distribute performant TypeScript as sources.

This is currently being called "fast check".

title: fix: update DEFAULT_DENO_REGISTRY_URL
fix: dynamic arg module search should ignore specific folder names
body: I think the dynamic argument module search should ignore certain folder names as they are almost guaranteed to not be wanted. This excludes hidden folders and folders named `node_modules` or `vendor`.

title: fix(symbols): ambient namespace members should always be considered as exported
body:
https://ts-ast-viewer.com/#

![image](https://github.com/denoland/deno_graph/assets/1609021/010aa55d-09b3-4887-9411-965ca7e7d9cd)

title: feat: expose referrer's `Range` in `Resolver`
body: This allows me to display a warning when resolving an `--unstable-loose-import`.

title: fix(read_dir): analyze deps stably and do not analyze root dir
body:
Some changes for the dynamic import search.

1. Sort the specifiers so the output is stable.
2. Ignore specifiers like `file:///${expr}` because that will include the root dir

title: fix: add range to dir read warn message
fix: export `DynamicTemplatePart`
chore: update import_map to 0.18.0
fix: dynamic arg search should not find self
body:
Handles not finding itself when the folder is the same:

```ts
const file = await import(`./${expr}`);
```

title: fix: export new analyzer types
body: Forgot to export these.

title: feat: include some possible dynamic imports with template literals in graph

1. This does not have a directory entry limit.
2. This swallows errors.

Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno_graph/issues/275

title: feat(symbols): resolve re-exported names and other various improvements
body: This contains a bug fix. I have too many changes going on to bother opening separate PRs.

title: fix(symbols): deps - understand member exprs
fix(workspace): use IndexMap instead of HashMap for exports
body: This helps add some stability in error messages and in the future order might matter.

title: feat(jsr): add package exports
body: Adds a requirement for packages to define exports.

title: feat(symbols): move SymbolDeps out of the symbol graph
body: These are now lazily computed as there's no reason for these to be in the symbol graph.

title: feat(symbols): add parent ids
body: Adds the concept of parent identifiers.

title: feat(symbols): ability to get where a "go to definition" failed and add a symbol for each module
body:
This adds a `Symbol` for each module (same as what the typescript compiler does) and renames `ModuleSymbol` to `ModuleInfo` to prevent confusion.

Additionally, it's now possible to see where a "go to defintion" failed.

title: feat(symbols): combine Symbol with SymbolMember
body: It will be easier if everything is just a symbol.

title: feat: ability to easily get types module from graph
body:
This code from deno_doc is useful for general use.

https://github.com/denoland/deno_doc/blob/bb11d9e8eeddaa7fe26b14fc7b5463cd042fc550/src/parser.rs#L1181

title: feat(symbols): definition paths
body: This allows seeing the path from a symbol to a definition.

title: Rename types.d.ts to type.ts
body: Declaration files should only be used to represent types that result from the transpilation of TypeScript to JavaScript. In a TypeScript context, it can cause issues that, from my understanding, relate to ambient types.

title: feat(symbols): symbol members

~~Waiting on https://github.com/denoland/deno_graph/pull/317~~

This is actually going to be mostly rewritten in https://github.com/denoland/deno_graph/pull/322 , but it's easier to land this one first because I have a draft PR inbetween these two.

feat: add ModuleGraphError::TypesResolutionError
body:
Adds a new `TypesResolutionError` so that it's easier to identify which resolution errors are for type checking or not and enhance the error messages.

FYI @nayeemrmn. For some reason I can't add you as a reviewer.

title: feat(tracing): include fn implementation signatures in list of symbol declarations
body: This is for deno_doc for analyzing implementation signatures.

title: perf: do not resolve more types when GraphKind::CodeOnly
body:
It seems when GraphKind::CodeOnly we were doing a lot of extra work that we didn't need to do. This should make things faster when just running without type checking.

I noticed this while working on https://github.com/denoland/deno_graph/pull/304

Also closes #266

body: Increases the resolution of what's exposed.

body: And other various fixes.

title: feat: deno_ast 0.30
fix(resolver): resolution with ResolutionMode::Types should be attempted
body: Makes https://github.com/denoland/deno_graph/pull/303 actually work.

title: feat(resolver): add resolution mode
body: This is necessary for BYONM so that I can tell if "types" resolution is currently being done or "code"/"execution" resolution. With node resolution we could end up at different files based on what resolution is being done (unlike with Deno resolution, which is much simpler).

title: feat(type_tracing): store swc nodes with symbol
body:
This adds the ability to get the swc declaration from a symbol. This is useful for deno_doc because we can take a module symbol, then traverse the exports creating DocNodes.

I have good internet connection now, so I'm going to stop working on the deno_doc update after this PR and get back to other more important things.

title: fix(type_tracing): range for default decl should be the decl range
fix(type_tracing): support json modules
fix: add is_bare_node_specifier_enabled to NpmResolver trait
body:
This PR adds `is_bare_node_specifier_enabled` to `NpmResolver` to enable feature flagging of bare node specifier resolution.

related https://github.com/denoland/deno/pull/20728

title: fix: check bare node specifier for ImportMapError::UnmappedBareSpecifier
body:
This PR adds bare node specifier check when the `ResolveError` from `resolver.resolve` is `Other(ImportMapError::UnmappedBareSpecifier(_, _))`.

By this change, we can keep more detailed error message from `ImportMapError`, for example, like `Relative import path "unmapped" not prefixed with / or ./ or ../ and not in import map from "file://[WILDCARD]/092_import_map_unmapped_bare_specifier.ts"`

related https://github.com/denoland/deno/pull/20728

title: fix: pass range to on_resolve_bare_builtin_node_module
body: This PR passes `Range` to `on_resolve_bare_builtin_node_module`. This is necessary to implement https://github.com/denoland/deno/pull/20728

title: feat: add ResolveError type
body: Will make moving a check to a higher level easier in https://github.com/denoland/deno_graph/pull/295 (will comment there soon)

title: feat: resolve node builtin module without node: scheme
body:
part of https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/20566

This PR updates the resolution of bare specifiers. If the module specifier is node builtin module as a bare specifier, resolve it as `node:<module_name>`. Also it prints the warning message like `Warning: Resolving "path" as "node:path". If you want to use a built-in Node module, add a "node:" prefix.`

title: docs(README): update MemoryLoader example
body: The example in README looks outdated. This PR updates it.

title: ci: upgrade caching
feat(type_tracing): store the traced referrers
body: Improves the functionality in https://github.com/denoland/deno_graph/pull/278 to store the traced referrers. This is useful for declaration emit in order to tell which modules import a remote dependency and what names they import.

title: feat: ability to get public exports w/ dependent private types of specified entrypoints
body:
This is my personal code from https://github.com/dsherret/libpack/blob/1abd1292ff231ae3ea1015a46a4b7ca4c24305c6/rs_lib/src/dts/mod.rs

I think it would be usefulf or deno_doc in order to make it more advanced. I'm adding it here so both projects can share the same code.

Essentially what this does is provided some entrypoints, it will analyze all those entrypoints and return back all the public types along with their dependencies (cross file). This is useful for stuff like a dts declaration-based emit (which libpack does) and deno doc.

title: refactor: remove the default implementation of ModuleGraph
body: We should be forced to think about what kind of graph we're creating whenever we create one for performance reasons.

title: feat: deno_ast 0.27
ci: unpin setup-deno
fix: check all import ranges in Dependency::includes()
body: This is preventing the LSP hover text on repeated imports from including certain dependency information: https://github.com/denoland/deno/blob/5a524a9a5a7fac0d16b2cbe2df1142dc419df7fc/cli/lsp/documents.rs#L603.

feat: ability to skip walking dependencies of the last walked module
body: I want this so that I can walk the graph and when I hit a certain module I can say "that's enough... please don't bother walking this module's dependencies". Probably in the future we should rethink this whole .walk method to be more versatile.

title: feat: upgrade to deno_ast 0.25
fix: graph imports should use specified order
body: These should use the order specified rather than alphabetical order.

title: feat: add specifiers_count() for getting the approximate number of specifiers in the graph
body: There are some pre-allocations we're not doing in the CLI because we don't have this information.

title: feat: serialize and deserialize `Version` as string
body: In the npm dependency resolution code we're constantly parsing strings to `Versions`. If we instead serialized/deserialized this as a string then we could use `Version` on the npm package info struct directly in order to parse the versions a single time.

title: feat: store import sites on dependencies
body: Towards #228. Stops short of introducing `ImportError` / checking assertions because that's where it starts needing to be broken in. They're not included in the json yet since the schema needs a _little_ more scrutiny, but the serialization code is there to iterate on and is usable in the rust API.

title: refactor: separate `ModuleError` from `ModuleGraphError`
body: Towards #228

title: refactor: revert change to include specifier text on Range
body: This largely reverts https://github.com/denoland/deno_graph/pull/243 -- which I should have realized wasn't necessary.

title: fix: require jsxImportSource to be in a multi-line comment
body: Closes #66

title: fix: make ts reference paths type-only deps
body:
`<reference path="..." />` doesn't create a runtime dependency. Extracted from #228.
Prevents the following module from failing on a no-check graph validation:
```ts
/// <reference path="./nonexistent.d.ts" />
```

title: fix: derive more traits on errors
chore: add test for remote importing local with uppercase file specifier
fix: allow remapping a remote non-file specifier to a local file
body: I wrote this code in such a way that we can do a patch update for Deno.

title: fix: remote imports should be allowed to import data urls
body: For https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/17914

title: refactor: `NpmPackageId` -> `NpmPackageNv`
body:
This naming is much easier to deal with in the CLI integration. `NpmPackageNameVersion` is too long and this allows us to have the following naming for this struct in the CLI:

```rs
struct NpmPackageId {
  nv: NpmPackageNv,
  peer_dependencies: Vec<NpmPackageId>,
}
```

Usually I don't like acronyms, but this is used so prevalently that I think it's worth it here.

title: refactor: cleanup serialize functions
body: Simplify serialize definitions for  `module_slots`, `graph_imports` and `dependencies`. Derive as much as possible, deduplicate handling between derived field attributes and overrided serialize functions.

title: feat: add `Version::parse_standard`
body:
I want to use this for `deno upgrade` because it allows us to drop the semver crate.

Closes #234

title: feat: move invalid local import and downlevel errors to `validate` method
body: This is to have better `deno vendor` support. I'm seeing some more refactors we could do in deno_graph we should do after doing this.

title: feat: add npm specifiers to the graph
body:
We're going to rely on integration tests in the CLI for this atm (opened #241 for the future).

Closes #230

title: feat: add sorting for `NpmPackageReq`
body: From https://github.com/denoland/deno/pull/17272/files#diff-37eccd30b5732ee9a5aeca31a10b97ecd200cb8e5346c22f122183f7e1dce237R148

title: feat: add npm module
body:
This adds a new `npm` module, which will be integrated into the graph sometime next week. For now, it's just an extraction of the CLI code, but using `thiserror` for the errors.

It has:

* `NpmPackageReference` - A reference to an npm package req and potential subpath.
* `NpmPackageReq` - The name and version constraint component of an `NpmPackageReference` (so no subpath).
* `NpmPackageId` - A resolved identifier for an npm package.

I'm thinking that we probably won't have the npm resolution code in deno_graph, but rather just expose a way for someone to resolve an `NpmPackageReq` to an `NpmPackageId`. It would then be up to consumers to resolve and handle the rest of the npm dependency tree.

title: feat: add semver module
body:
This extracts out the semver module from the CLI

https://github.com/denoland/deno/tree/main/cli/semver

Although we could extract this out to another crate/repo, it's probably not worth it. I'm working on adding the npm code to deno_graph after this pr.

title: chore: fix release script
refactor: revert result_large_err clippy change and allow it
body: I have a feeling this clippy recommendation is wrong for the most part (because `Ok(Module)` is larger?). This change started some tests failing in the CLI because now the error wasn't matching some downcasting at runtime and needed to be unboxed. These methods aren't called a lot so maybe let's just ignore this clippy rule?
